piuoui .\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - ncertainties/missing_fields/suggested_questions为空数组[];\n  - structured_summary为全null；\n- normalized_understanding：300-600个英文字符，必须是你对研究的“当前理解”，语言规范、聚焦、可检索；不要写“我认为/可能”等口水话，直接用陈述句组织。\n- 如果 是B_plausible，且 is_clear_for_search=true，则：\n  - is_research_description = true\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空数组或只保留0-1条轻微风险\n  - guidance_to_user 为空\n- 如果 是B_plausible，且 is_clear_for_search=false，则：\n  - is_research_description = true\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - missing_fields 仅列出缺失项\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与 uncertainties/missing_fields 对应\n  - guidance_to_user 给用户如何回答问题的提示（<=300字符）\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible，则：\n  - is_clear_for_search=false\n  - suggested_questions 为空\n  - uncertainties=[]\n  - guidance_to_user 给出impossible的提示。\n"}

patients vs healthy participants)?\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"field\": \"task\",\n      \"question\": \"What is the control objective and main evaluation outcomes (e.g., modulate alpha power, prevent seizures, improve mood/attention), and in what setting (lab, home, wearable)?\"\n    }\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": \"Answer with concrete choices: (1) the stimulation/feedback modality, (2) the application and population, and (3) the control target and outcome metrics. These details will make the topic searchable and help form precise query terms.\"\n}"}
{"ts": "2026-01-01T16:21:57.330547+00:00", "event": "parse.stage2.prompt", "project_id": "7742e29afd07", "run_id": "0f67f0f04e14", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt_file": "/Users/xiaowu/local_code/scholarmap/prompts/parse_stage2_converge.md", "prompt": "你是“研究描述自我收敛器”。你将收到三段文本：\n(1) 当前候选研究描述 current_description\n(2) 关于当前研究描述的问题question_for_user\n(3) 用户本轮补充信息 user_additional_info（可能回答了你上轮的问题，也可能没有）\n\n你的任务是：\n1) 判断当前候选研究描述和用户本轮补充信息是不是关于一类研究方向的描述，还是其他（比如小说，诗歌，日志等）。如果是研究描述就返回is_research_description=true，并将两段文本融合，形成你对研究内容的“当前理解”，并判断更新后的研究内容是否合理：\n- A_impossible：明显荒诞/违背当前科技常识，无法形成合理检索任务\n- B_plausible：合理可行\n2) 如果A_impossible，给出简单的理由。如果新的理解是合理可行的，就用规范、聚焦、可检索的英文重写（300-600英文字符），这段重写用于帮助用户组织语言与规范表述。\n3) 判断本轮补充的信息是否对解答question_for_user有帮助。有帮助的话就返回 is_helpful=true。\n4) 如果在新增信息后仍不清晰：输出你仍不确定的点（uncertainties），并提出最多3个澄清问题（具体可回答，优先信息增益最大）。\n5) 如果已经清晰：不要再提问题；只输出你的理解与结构化摘要。\n6) 输出结构化摘要（最小可检索闭包字段）：\ndomain, task, subject_system, methods, scope, intent, exclusions\n只输出JSON，不输出任何额外文字。\n\ncurrent_description：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on EEG signals.\"\"\"\n\nquestion_for_user：\n\"\"\"What specific closed-loop intervention is adapted by EEG (e.g., neurofeedback, tDCS/tACS, TMS, sensory stimulation), and is it noninvasive or invasive?\nWhat is the primary application area and target population (clinical condition or cognitive function; patients vs healthy participants)?\nWhat is the control objective and main evaluation outcomes (e.g., modulate alpha power, prevent seizures, improve mood/attention), and in what setting (lab, home, wearable)?\"\"\"\n\n\nuser_additional_info（用户本轮补充信息，可能为空）：\n\"\"\"The intervention is TMS modulation.\nThe application and population is not restricted. THere is no restriction on the objective and outcomes.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户如何补充信息\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

{"ts": "2026-01-01T16:52:44.200216+00:00", "event": "parse.stage2.prompt", "project_id": "7742e29afd07", "run_id": "06d79b53c489", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt_file": "/Users/xiaowu/local_code/scholarmap/prompts/parse_stage2_converge.md", "prompt": "你是“研究描述自我收敛器”。你将收到三段文本：\n(1) 当前候选研究描述 current_description\n(2) 关于当前研究描述的问题question_for_user\n(3) 用户本轮补充信息 user_additional_info（可能回答了你上轮的问题，也可能没有）\n\n你的任务是：\n1) 判断当前候选研究描述和用户本轮补充信息是不是关于一类研究方向的描述，还是其他（比如小说，诗歌，日志等）。如果是研究描述就返回is_research_description=true，并将两段文本融合，形成你对研究内容的“当前理解”，并判断更新后的研究内容是否合理：\n- A_impossible：明显荒诞/违背当前科技常识，无法形成合理检索任务\n- B_plausible：合理可行\n2) 如果A_impossible，给出简单的理由。如果新的理解是合理可行的，就用规范、聚焦、可检索的英文重写（300-600英文字符），这段重写用于帮助用户组织语言与规范表述。\n3) 判断本轮补充的信息是否对解答question_for_user有帮助。有帮助的话就返回 is_helpful=true。\n4) 如果在新增信息后仍不清晰：输出你仍不确定的点（uncertainties），并提出最多3个澄清问题（具体可回答，优先信息增益最大）。\n5) 如果已经清晰：不要再提问题；只输出你的理解与结构化摘要。\n6) 输出结构化摘要（最小可检索闭包字段）：\ndomain, task, subject_system, methods, scope, intent, exclusions\n只输出JSON，不输出任何额外文字。\n\ncurrent_description：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on the EEG singals.\"\"\"\n\nquestion_for_user：\n\"\"\"What is the closed-loop intervention output: neurofeedback only, or physical stimulation (tES/tDCS/tACS, TMS), and what variable is controlled (amplitude, phase, timing, frequency)?\nWhich application area and participant group are you targeting (healthy subjects vs a specific disorder), and what primary outcomes will you measure (EEG biomarkers, symptoms, behavior)?\nIs your main contribution algorithmic (EEG decoding/control), system engineering (real-time pipeline), or experimental/clinical evaluation, and what key methods (e.g., RL, adaptive filtering) are central?\"\"\"\n\n\nuser_additional_info（用户本轮补充信息，可能为空）：\n\"\"\"1, The modulation type is TMS. There is no restriction on the population or target condition, or the contribution or core algorithms.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户如何补充信息\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

The goal is to design and evaluate a feedback control pipeline that links ongoing brain-state estimates to stimulation delivery, enabling state-dependent or adaptive TMS to modulate targeted neural dynamics measured in EEG.\",\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": \"Closed-loop neuromodulation / neuroengineering (EEG + TMS)\",\n    \"task\": \"Real-time EEG-driven control of TMS in a closed-loop system\",\n    \"subject_system\": \"Human brain activity measured by EEG with TMS as intervention output\",\n    \"methods\": \"Online EEG feature extraction/decoding; closed-loop control/adaptation of TMS parameters (e.g., timing/phase/intensity); real-time pipeline\",\n    \"scope\": \"Unspecified population/condition; unspecified controlled variable and outcomes\",\n    \"intent\": \"Use EEG biomarkers to guide adaptive/state-dependent TMS for modulating neural activity\",\n    \"exclusions\": \"Not limited to neurofeedback-only; no fixed disorder, algorithm family, or evaluation setting specified\"\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [\n    \"Which TMS control variable(s) are adapted from EEG (timing/phase, intensity, frequency, coil targeting) and what EEG biomarkers drive the loop.\",\n    \"Target application and evaluation: participant group, experimental paradigm, and primary outcomes (EEG changes vs behavioral/clinical endpoints).\",\n    \"Main contribution emphasis (algorithmic control/decoding vs system engineering vs experimental validation) and constraints (latency, safety, real-time requirements).\"\n  ],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\n    \"domain\",\n    \"task\",\n    \"subject_system\",\n    \"methods\",\n    \"scope\",\n    \"intent\",\n    \"exclusions\"\n  ],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\n      \"field\": \"methods\",\n      \"question\": \"What EEG features/biomarkers will drive the loop (e.g., alpha power, ERPs, phase) and which TMS parameter(s) will be controlled (timing/phase, intensity, frequency/pattern)?\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"field\": \"scope\",\n      \"question\": \"What is the intended use case: healthy participants or a specific disorder, and what primary outcomes will you measure (EEG biomarkers, behavior, symptoms)?\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"field\": \"intent\",\n      \"question\": \"Is your main contribution the control/decoding algorithm, the real-time closed-loop system implementation, or experimental/clinical validation?\"\n    }\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": \"To make this searchable, specify the EEG biomarker(s), the exact TMS parameter(s) adapted in the loop, the target population/use case, and the primary outcomes plus whether your contribution is algorithmic, system, or evaluation.\"\n}", "project_id": "7742e29afd07", "run_id": "06d79b53c489", "stage": "stage2"}

There is no restriction on the population or target condition, or the contribution or core algorithms.\"\"\"\n\nquestion_for_user：\n\"\"\"What EEG features/biomarkers will drive the loop (e.g., alpha power, ERPs, phase) and which TMS parameter(s) will be controlled (timing/phase, intensity, frequency/pattern)?\nWhat is the intended use case: healthy participants or a specific disorder, and what primary outcomes will you measure (EEG biomarkers, behavior, symptoms)?\nIs your main contribution the control/decoding algorithm, the real-time closed-loop system implementation, or experimental/clinical validation?\"\"\"\n\n\nuser_additional_info（用户本轮补充信息，可能为空）：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on the EEG singals.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n  - The aim is to build and study a feedback system that senses ongoing brain activity and modulates TMS accordingly. human vs animal; real-time constraints and evaluation metrics).\"\n  ],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\n    \"subject_system\",\n    \"methods\",\n    \"scope\",\n    \"intent\"\n  ],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\n      \"field\": \"methods\",\n      \"question\": \"What neuromodulation modality and control output are you using (e.g., neurofeedback, tACS/tDCS, TMS, DBS), and is it invasive or noninvasive?\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"field\": \"intent\",\n      \"question\": \"What is the primary application/clinical condition and target outcome (e.g., seizure reduction, sleep stage enhancement, symptom improvement), and which EEG biomarkers/states drive the loop?\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"field\": \"scope\",\n      \"question\": \"What is the study setting and population (human patients, healthy participants, or animals), and what key evaluation metrics matter most (latency, accuracy, symptom change, safety)?\"\n    }\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": \"Answer with concrete choices: stimulation modality (and invasive/noninvasive), application/condition + EEG biomarker and outcome, and population/setting + key metrics. These specifics will make the description directly searchable.\"\n}"}
{"ts": "2026-01-01T22:09:21.930840+00:00", "event": "parse.stage2.prompt", "project_id": "7742e29afd07", "run_id": "33bbf1b1bb7e", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt_file": "/Users/xiaowu/local_code/scholarmap/prompts/parse_stage2_converge.md", "prompt": "你是“研究描述自我收敛器”。你将收到三段文本：\n(1) 当前候选研究描述 current_description\n(2) 关于当前研究描述的问题question_for_user\n(3) 用户本轮补充信息 user_additional_info（可能回答了你上轮的问题，也可能没有）\n\n你的任务是：\n1) 判断当前候选研究描述和用户本轮补充信息是不是关于一类研究方向的描述，还是其他（比如小说，诗歌，日志等）。如果是研究描述就返回is_research_description=true，并将两段文本融合，形成你对研究内容的“当前理解”，并判断更新后的研究内容是否合理：\n- A_impossible：明显荒诞/违背当前科技常识，无法形成合理检索任务\n- B_plausible：合理可行\n2) 如果A_impossible，给出简单的理由。如果新的理解是合理可行的，就用规范、聚焦、可检索的英文重写（300-600英文字符），这段重写用于帮助用户组织语言与规范表述。\n3) 判断本轮补充的信息是否对解答question_for_user有帮助。有帮助的话就返回 is_helpful=true。\n4) 如果在新增信息后仍不清晰：输出你仍不确定的点（uncertainties），并提出最多3个澄清问题（具体可回答，优先信息增益最大）。\n5) 如果已经清晰：不要再提问题；只输出你的理解与结构化摘要。\n6) 输出结构化摘要（最小可检索闭包字段）：\ndomain, task, subject_system, methods, scope, intent, exclusions\n只输出JSON，不输出任何额外文字。\n\ncurrent_description：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on the EEG signals.\"\"\"\n\nquestion_for_user：\n\"\"\"What neuromodulation modality and control output are you using (e.g., neurofeedback, tACS/tDCS, TMS, DBS), and is it invasive or noninvasive?\nWhat is the primary application/clinical condition and target outcome (e.g., seizure reduction, sleep stage enhancement, symptom improvement), and which EEG biomarkers/states drive the loop?\nWhat is the study setting and population (human patients, healthy participants, or animals), and what key evaluation metrics matter most (latency, accuracy, symptom change, safety)?\"\"\"\n\n\nuser_additional_info（用户本轮补充信息，可能为空）：\n\"\"\"The modality is TMS, the stimulation is noninvasive. There is no restriction on the application, biomarker, population and experimental settings.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户如何补充信息\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

The work broadly targets methods and control strategies for EEG–TMS closed-loop systems, without committing to a specific clinical application, biomarker, population, or experimental setting.\",\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": \"Closed-loop neuromodulation / neuroengineering (EEG–TMS)\",\n    \"task\": \"Design and evaluate EEG-driven closed-loop control of TMS stimulation parameters\",\n    \"subject_system\": \"Noninvasive human brain stimulation with concurrent EEG monitoring (population unspecified)\",\n    \"methods\": \"Real-time EEG feature extraction/state estimation; There is no restriction on the population/model, brain state, approach or evaluation metrics.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ],\n  \"guidance_to_user\": string\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户如何补充信息\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - guidance_to_user <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

guidance_to_user 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - ncertainties/missing_fields/suggested_questions为空数组[];\n  - structured_summary为全null；\n- normalized_understanding：300-600个英文字符，必须是你对研究的“当前理解”，语言规范、聚焦、可检索；不要写“我认为/可能”等口水话，直接用陈述句组织。\n- 如果 是B_plausible，且 is_clear_for_search=true，则：\n  - is_research_description = true\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空数组或只保留0-1条轻微风险\n  - guidance_to_user 为空\n- 如果 是B_plausible，且 is_clear_for_search=false，则：\n  - is_research_description = true\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - missing_fields 仅列出缺失项\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与 uncertainties/missing_fields 对应\n  - guidance_to_user 给用户如何回答问题的提示（<=300字符）\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible，则：\n  - is_clear_for_search=false\n  - suggested_questions 为空\n  - uncertainties=[]\n  - guidance_to_user 给出impossible的提示。\n"}

{"ts": "2026-01-03T00:10:43.932418+00:00", "event": "parse.stage2.prompt", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "b449372ed297", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt_file": "/Users/xiaowu/local_code/scholarmap/prompts/parse_stage2_converge.md", "prompt": "你是“研究描述自我收敛器”。你将收到三段文本：\n(1) 当前候选研究描述 current_description\n(2) 关于当前研究描述的问题question_for_user\n(3) 用户本轮补充信息 user_additional_info（可能回答了你上轮的问题，也可能没有）\n\n你的任务是：\n1) 判断当前候选研究描述和用户本轮补充信息是不是关于一类研究方向的描述，还是其他（比如小说，诗歌，日志等）。如果是研究描述就返回is_research_description=true，并将两段文本融合，形成你对研究内容的“当前理解”，并判断更新后的研究内容是否合理：\n- A_impossible：明显荒诞/违背当前科技常识，无法形成合理检索任务\n- B_plausible：合理可行\n2) 如果A_impossible，给出简单的理由。如果新的理解是合理可行的，就用规范、聚焦、可检索的英文重写（300-600英文字符），这段重写用于帮助用户组织语言与规范表述。\n3) 判断本轮补充的信息是否对解答question_for_user有帮助。有帮助的话就返回 is_helpful=true。\n4) 如果在新增信息后仍不清晰：输出你仍不确定的点（uncertainties），并提出最多3个澄清问题（具体可回答，优先信息增益最大）。\n5) 如果已经清晰：不要再提问题；只输出你的理解与结构化摘要。\n6) 输出结构化摘要（最小可检索闭包字段）：\ndomain, task, subject_system, methods, scope, intent, exclusions\n只输出JSON，不输出任何额外文字。\n\ncurrent_description：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on the EEG signals.\"\"\"\n\nquestion_for_user：\n\"\"\"Which neuromodulation modality are you studying (e.g., tACS/tDCS, TMS, DBS, VNS, or EEG neurofeedback), and is it invasive or noninvasive?\nWhat is the primary application and endpoint (e.g., epilepsy seizure suppression, depression, sleep modulation, motor rehabilitation, attention enhancement), and what outcome metrics are used?\nWhat is the study setting: human participants or animal models, and is the loop closed in real time during stimulation or evaluated offline/simulation?\"\"\"\n\n\nuser_additional_info（用户本轮补充信息，可能为空）：\n\"\"\"I focus on the TMS modality. There is no restriction on the application, endpoint, outcome metrics, study setting.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ]\n  }\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - uncertainties 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

is_research_description = true\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空数组或只保留0-1条轻微风险\n\n- 如果 是B_plausible，且 is_clear_for_search=false，则：\n  - is_research_description = true\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - {"ts": "2026-01-03T00:39:27.485227+00:00", "event": "llm.complete_text.response", "model": "gpt-5.2", "api": "chat/completions", "full_prompt": "你是“研究描述理解与规范化”模块。输入是一段纯文本候选研究描述。你的目标是帮助用户把研究描述变得合理且清晰，便于后续生成文献检索查询。\n\n你必须完成：\n1) 判断这段描述是不是关于一类研究方向的描述，还是其他（比如小说，诗歌，日志等）。如果是研究描述就返回is_research_description=true.\n2) 如果是研究描述,进行常识可行性判断（plausibility_level）：\n- A_impossible：明显荒诞/违背当前科技常识（无法形成合理检索任务）\n- B_plausible：合理可行\n3) 如果合理可行，给出你对该研究描述的“当前理解”（normalized_understanding），用规范化、聚焦、可检索的英语重写，\n4) 判断当前理解是否已经清晰到可以用于检索；若不清晰，列出你仍不确定的点（疑问清单），并提出最多3个澄清问题（问题必须具体可回答）。\n5) 输出结构化提要（最小可检索闭包字段）：\ndomain, task, subject_system, methods, scope, intent, exclusions\n6) 只输出JSON，不输出任何额外文本。\n\n候选研究描述：\n\"\"\"I focus on closed-loop neural modulation based on the EEG signals.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ]\n}\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - {"ts": "2026-01-03T00:41:04.190982+00:00", "event": "phase1.parse.prompt", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "1e4aa1babd33", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt": "You are an expert academic search strategist specializing in exhaustive literature retrieval. \n\nBelow is a short research summary, your task is to take above research summary and directly produce a conceptual retrieval framework that can be used to systematically search for all relevant literature in that research field.\n\n-- research summary begin --\nThe research focuses on EEG-driven closed-loop neuromodulation using transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) as the intervention. EEG is continuously recorded, decoded to estimate brain state, and used to adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time to modulate neural activity. The work broadly targets developing and evaluating online control pipelines for EEG-to-TMS closed-loop systems, without committing to a specific clinical application, endpoint, population, or a single decoding/control methodology.\n-- research summary end --\n\nThis is NOT a query-generation task.\nThis is a concept-framework construction task.\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Base the framework ONLY on the content explicitly stated or clearly implied in the research summary.\n   - Do NOT introduce new research goals, populations, or application domains.\n   - Do NOT speculate beyond the summary.\n\n2. The output must define a SMALL NUMBER of concept blocks (typically 2–4).\n   - Each block represents a distinct and independently searchable conceptual dimension\nthat should not be merged with other dimensions if doing so would reduce recall.\n   - Examples include: research task, technical field/framing, data modality.\n   - All blocks together must uniquely define ONE narrow research field.\n\nIMPORTANT — Concept Block Separation Rule:\n\nWhen constructing concept blocks, prioritize retrieval independence over semantic compactness.\n\nIf two concepts frequently appear separately in relevant literature\n(e.g., one may be mentioned without the other in titles/abstracts),\nthey MUST be placed in separate concept blocks,\neven if they form a well-known combined phrase or subfield name.\n\nExample:\n- “speech” and “brain-computer interface” must be separate blocks,\n  because many relevant papers mention speech decoding without explicitly using “BCI”,\n  and others mention BCI without explicitly using “speech”.\n\n\n3. Each concept block must:\n   - Contain only terms that are conceptually equivalent within that block.\n   - Be expressed using terminology commonly found in academic databases.\n   - Include common synonyms, abbreviations, and canonical terms used in the literature.\n\n4. When the summary uses abstract or high-level language, normalize it into concrete, database-searchable concepts\n   ONLY when such normalization is standard practice in the field.\n   - Example: “invasive recordings” → ECoG, sEEG, intracortical recordings, MEA\n   - Do NOT introduce loosely related or adjacent techniques.\n\n5. All concept blocks must be REQUIRED.\n   - The framework should be designed for exhaustive retrieval within a specific field,\n     not for exploratory or cross-domain search.\n\n6. Do NOT generate executable Boolean queries.\n   - You MAY describe the logical relationship between blocks conceptually\n     (e.g., “documents must address all blocks simultaneously”),\n     but do not use database syntax.\n\n7. Explicitly prevent topic drift.\n   - The framework should clearly exclude adjacent but distinct research areas.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n### Block B: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n(Repeat blocks as needed)\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nA single sentence explaining how all blocks jointly define the target literature set.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n- Out-of-scope:\n"}
{"ts": "2026-01-03T00:41:26.779177+00:00", "event": "llm.complete_text.response", "model": "gpt-5.2", "api": "chat/completions", "full_prompt": "You are an expert academic search strategist specializing in exhaustive literature retrieval. \n\nBelow is a short research summary, your task is to take above research summary and directly produce a conceptual retrieval framework that can be used to systematically search for all relevant literature in that research field.\n\n-- research summary begin --\nThe research focuses on EEG-driven closed-loop neuromodulation using transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) as the intervention. EEG is continuously recorded, decoded to estimate brain state, and used to adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time to modulate neural activity. The work broadly targets developing and evaluating online control pipelines for EEG-to-TMS closed-loop systems, without committing to a specific clinical application, endpoint, population, or a single decoding/control methodology.\n-- research summary end --\n\nThis is NOT a query-generation task.\nThis is a concept-framework construction task.\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Base the framework ONLY on the content explicitly stated or clearly implied in the research summary.\n   - Do NOT introduce new research goals, populations, or application domains.\n   - Do NOT speculate beyond the summary.\n\n2. The output must define a SMALL NUMBER of concept blocks (typically 2–4).\n   - Each block represents a distinct and independently searchable conceptual dimension\nthat should not be merged with other dimensions if doing so would reduce recall.\n   - Examples include: research task, technical field/framing, data modality.\n   - All blocks together must uniquely define ONE narrow research field.\n\nIMPORTANT — Concept Block Separation Rule:\n\nWhen constructing concept blocks, prioritize retrieval independence over semantic compactness.\n\nIf two concepts frequently appear separately in relevant literature\n(e.g., one may be mentioned without the other in titles/abstracts),\nthey MUST be placed in separate concept blocks,\neven if they form a well-known combined phrase or subfield name.\n\nExample:\n- “speech” and “brain-computer interface” must be separate blocks,\n  because many relevant papers mention speech decoding without explicitly using “BCI”,\n  and others mention BCI without explicitly using “speech”.\n\n\n3. Each concept block must:\n   - Contain only terms that are conceptually equivalent within that block.\n   - Be expressed using terminology commonly found in academic databases.\n   - Include common synonyms, abbreviations, and canonical terms used in the literature.\n\n4. When the summary uses abstract or high-level language, normalize it into concrete, database-searchable concepts\n   ONLY when such normalization is standard practice in the field.\n   - Example: “invasive recordings” → ECoG, sEEG, intracortical recordings, MEA\n   - Do NOT introduce loosely related or adjacent techniques.\n\n5. All concept blocks must be REQUIRED.\n   - The framework should be designed for exhaustive retrieval within a specific field,\n     not for exploratory or cross-domain search.\n\n6. Do NOT generate executable Boolean queries.\n   - You MAY describe the logical relationship between blocks conceptually\n     (e.g., “documents must address all blocks simultaneously”),\n     but do not use database syntax.\n\n7. Explicitly prevent topic drift.\n   - The framework should clearly exclude adjacent but distinct research areas.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n### Block B: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n(Repeat blocks as needed)\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nA single sentence explaining how all blocks jointly define the target literature set.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n- Out-of-scope:\n", "raw_response": "## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: Closed-loop / Real-time Adaptive Control (Neuromodulation Pipeline)\n- Concept Role: Captures the requirement that stimulation is adjusted online based on ongoing measurements (i.e., not open-loop or purely offline analysis).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - closed-loop\n  - closed loop\n  - feedback control\n  - feedback-controlled\n  - adaptive stimulation\n  - real-time\n  - realtime\n  - online\n  - state-dependent stimulation\n  - brain-state–dependent\n  - brain state dependent\n  - responsive stimulation\n  - closed-loop neuromodulation\n  - closed-loop stimulation\n  - control system\n  - controller\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Many relevant papers use “state-dependent,” “responsive,” or “feedback-controlled” without explicitly saying “closed-loop.”\n  - Include both “online” and “real-time,” as authors vary in phrasing.\n\n### Block B: EEG Sensing / Continuous EEG-based State Estimation\n- Concept Role: Ensures the loop is driven by EEG acquisition and EEG-derived brain-state decoding/estimation (not other sensing modalities).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - electroencephalography\n  - EEG\n  - scalp EEG\n  - continuous EEG\n  - ongoing EEG\n  - EEG monitoring\n  - EEG decoding\n  - EEG-based decoding\n  - brain-state decoding\n  - brain state estimation\n  - state estimation\n  - feature extraction (EEG)\n  - EEG biomarkers\n  - EEG phase\n  - oscillatory phase\n  - phase estimation\n  - spectral power\n  - band power\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - “Decoding” may appear as “state estimation,” “classification,” or “biomarker-driven,” but the common denominator is EEG-derived state used for control.\n  - Include “phase”/“oscillatory phase” because EEG-to-stimulation timing is often framed as phase-locked or phase-triggered control.\n\n### Block C: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as the Intervention (TMS Delivery)\n- Concept Role: Restricts the intervention to TMS (including parameter/timing adaptation), excluding other stimulation modalities.\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - transcranial magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS\n  - single-pulse TMS\n  - paired-pulse TMS\n  - repetitive TMS\n  - rTMS\n  - theta burst stimulation\n  - TBS\n  - magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS pulse timing\n  - stimulation timing\n  - stimulation parameter(s)\n  - stimulation intensity\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Some papers emphasize specific TMS paradigms (e.g., rTMS, TBS) rather than the generic term; include both.\n  - Timing/parameter language helps capture “adaptive TMS” papers that may not foreground “closed-loop” in the title/abstract.\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nDocuments must simultaneously involve (A) closed-loop/real-time adaptive control, (B) EEG-based continuous sensing and brain-state estimation/decoding, and (C) TMS as the stimulation intervention being adapted.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n  - EEG-driven closed-loop (feedback/online/state-dependent/responsive) systems that adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time based on decoded/estimated brain state from EEG.\n  - Methodological development and evaluation of EEG-to-TMS online control pipelines (including decoding + controller + stimulation adaptation), independent of any specific clinical application.\n- Out-of-scope:\n  - Open-loop TMS studies (fixed timing/parameters) even if EEG is recorded only for analysis or outcome measurement.\n  - Closed-loop neuromodulation using non-EEG sensing (e.g., MEG, fMRI, ECoG, EMG) as the primary feedback signal.\n  - Closed-loop stimulation modalities other than TMS (e.g., tDCS/tACS/tES, DBS, VNS) even if EEG-driven.\n  - Pure EEG decoding/BCI papers with no TMS intervention, and TMS-EEG artifact/measurement papers that do not implement adaptive/closed-loop control.", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "1e4aa1babd33", "step": "parse"}

closed-loop\n  - closed loop\n  - feedback control\n  - feedback-controlled\n  - adaptive stimulation\n  - real-time\n  - realtime\n  - online\n  - state-dependent stimulation\n  - brain-state–dependent\n  - brain state dependent\n  - responsive stimulation\n  - closed-loop neuromodulation\n  - closed-loop stimulation\n  - control system\n  - controller\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Many relevant papers use “state-dependent,” “responsive,” or “feedback-controlled” without explicitly saying “closed-loop.”\n  - Include both “online” and “real-time,” as authors vary in phrasing.\n\n### Block B: EEG Sensing / Continuous EEG-based State Estimation\n- Concept Role: Ensures the loop is driven by EEG acquisition and EEG-derived brain-state decoding/estimation (not other sensing modalities).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - electroencephalography\n  - EEG\n  - scalp EEG\n  - continuous EEG\n  - ongoing EEG\n  - EEG monitoring\n  - EEG decoding\n  - EEG-based decoding\n  - brain-state decoding\n  - brain state estimation\n  - state estimation\n  - feature extraction (EEG)\n  - EEG biomarkers\n  - EEG phase\n  - oscillatory phase\n  - phase estimation\n  - spectral power\n  - band power\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - “Decoding” may appear as “state estimation,” “classification,” or “biomarker-driven,” but the common denominator is EEG-derived state used for control.\n  - Include “phase”/“oscillatory phase” because EEG-to-stimulation timing is often framed as phase-locked or phase-triggered control.\n\n### Block C: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as the Intervention (TMS Delivery)\n- Concept Role: Restricts the intervention to TMS (including parameter/timing adaptation), excluding other stimulation modalities.\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - transcranial magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS\n  - single-pulse TMS\n  - paired-pulse TMS\n  - repetitive TMS\n  - rTMS\n  - theta burst stimulation\n  - TBS\n  - magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS pulse timing\n  - stimulation timing\n  - stimulation parameter(s)\n  - stimulation intensity\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Some papers emphasize specific TMS paradigms (e.g., rTMS, TBS) rather than the generic term; include both.\n  - Timing/parameter language helps capture “adaptive TMS” papers that may not foreground “closed-loop” in the title/abstract.\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nDocuments must simultaneously involve (A) closed-loop/real-time adaptive control, (B) EEG-based continuous sensing and brain-state estimation/decoding, and (C) TMS as the stimulation intervention being adapted.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n  - EEG-driven closed-loop (feedback/online/state-dependent/responsive) systems that adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time based on decoded/estimated brain state from EEG.\n  - Methodological development and evaluation of EEG-to-TMS online control pipelines (including decoding + controller + stimulation adaptation), independent of any specific clinical application.\n- Out-of-scope:\n  - Open-loop TMS studies (fixed timing/parameters) even if EEG is recorded only for analysis or outcome measurement.\n  - Closed-loop neuromodulation using non-EEG sensing (e.g., MEG, fMRI, ECoG, EMG) as the primary feedback signal.\n  - Closed-loop stimulation modalities other than TMS (e.g., tDCS/tACS/tES, DBS, VNS) even if EEG-driven.\n  - Pure EEG decoding/BCI papers with no TMS intervention, and TMS-EEG artifact/measurement papers that do not implement adaptive/closed-loop control."}
{"ts": "2026-01-03T02:35:52.033010+00:00", "event": "phase1.query_build.prompt", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "1e4aa1babd33", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt": "You are an expert biomedical information retrieval engineer specializing in PubMed search strategies.\n\nBelow is a Conceptual Retrieval Framework, your task is to convert the framework into one or more executable PubMed search queries.\n\n-- Conceptual Retrieval Framework begin --\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: Closed-loop / Real-time Adaptive Control (Neuromodulation Pipeline)\n- Concept Role: Captures the requirement that stimulation is adjusted online based on ongoing measurements (i.e., not open-loop or purely offline analysis).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - closed-loop\n  - closed loop\n  - feedback control\n  - feedback-controlled\n  - adaptive stimulation\n  - real-time\n  - realtime\n  - online\n  - state-dependent stimulation\n  - brain-state–dependent\n  - brain state dependent\n  - responsive stimulation\n  - closed-loop neuromodulation\n  - closed-loop stimulation\n  - control system\n  - controller\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Many relevant papers use “state-dependent,” “responsive,” or “feedback-controlled” without explicitly saying “closed-loop.”\n  - Include both “online” and “real-time,” as authors vary in phrasing.\n\n### Block B: EEG Sensing / Continuous EEG-based State Estimation\n- Concept Role: Ensures the loop is driven by EEG acquisition and EEG-derived brain-state decoding/estimation (not other sensing modalities).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - electroencephalography\n  - EEG\n  - scalp EEG\n  - continuous EEG\n  - ongoing EEG\n  - EEG monitoring\n  - EEG decoding\n  - EEG-based decoding\n  - brain-state decoding\n  - brain state estimation\n  - state estimation\n  - feature extraction (EEG)\n  - EEG biomarkers\n  - EEG phase\n  - oscillatory phase\n  - phase estimation\n  - spectral power\n  - band power\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - “Decoding” may appear as “state estimation,” “classification,” or “biomarker-driven,” but the common denominator is EEG-derived state used for control.\n  - Include “phase”/“oscillatory phase” because EEG-to-stimulation timing is often framed as phase-locked or phase-triggered control.\n\n### Block C: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as the Intervention (TMS Delivery)\n- Concept Role: Restricts the intervention to TMS (including parameter/timing adaptation), excluding other stimulation modalities.\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - transcranial magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS\n  - single-pulse TMS\n  - paired-pulse TMS\n  - repetitive TMS\n  - rTMS\n  - theta burst stimulation\n  - TBS\n  - magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS pulse timing\n  - stimulation timing\n  - stimulation parameter(s)\n  - stimulation intensity\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Some papers emphasize specific TMS paradigms (e.g., rTMS, TBS) rather than the generic term; include both.\n  - Timing/parameter language helps capture “adaptive TMS” papers that may not foreground “closed-loop” in the title/abstract.\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nDocuments must simultaneously involve (A) closed-loop/real-time adaptive control, (B) EEG-based continuous sensing and brain-state estimation/decoding, and (C) TMS as the stimulation intervention being adapted.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n  - EEG-driven closed-loop (feedback/online/state-dependent/responsive) systems that adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time based on decoded/estimated brain state from EEG.\n  - Methodological development and evaluation of EEG-to-TMS online control pipelines (including decoding + controller + stimulation adaptation), independent of any specific clinical application.\n- Out-of-scope:\n  - Open-loop TMS studies (fixed timing/parameters) even if EEG is recorded only for analysis or outcome measurement.\n  - Closed-loop neuromodulation using non-EEG sensing (e.g., MEG, fMRI, ECoG, EMG) as the primary feedback signal.\n  - Closed-loop stimulation modalities other than TMS (e.g., tDCS/tACS/tES, DBS, VNS) even if EEG-driven.\n  - Pure EEG decoding/BCI papers with no TMS intervention, and TMS-EEG artifact/measurement papers that do not implement adaptive/closed-loop control.\n-- Conceptual Retrieval Framework end --\n\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Do NOT reinterpret, merge, or split any concept blocks.\n   - Treat each concept block as an independent retrieval dimension.\n   - Preserve the block structure exactly as given.\n\n2. For each concept block:\n   - Combine all normalized search terms within that block using OR.\n   - Apply PubMed field tags consistently, using Title/Abstract fields\n     unless a term is a standard abbreviation or acronym.\n\n3. Across concept blocks:\n   - Combine blocks using AND.\n   - The final query must require that all blocks are satisfied simultaneously.\n\n4. Do NOT introduce new search terms, synonyms, or expansions.\n   - Use ONLY the terms explicitly listed in the framework.\n\n5. Phrase handling:\n   - Multi-word terms must be enclosed in double quotation marks.\n   - Singular/plural variations should be preserved as given; do not infer new ones.\n\n6. PubMed field usage:\n   - Use [Title/Abstract] for most terms.\n   - Acronyms (e.g., BCI, ECoG, iEEG) may be used without field tags\n     only if they are standard and unambiguous.\n   - Do NOT use MeSH terms in this step.\n\n7. If a block contains usage constraints (e.g., “only when paired with X”),\n   enforce this by block-level AND logic, not by modifying individual terms.\n\n8. Output formatting:\n   - Clearly label each block’s query segment.\n   - Provide the final combined PubMed query in a single code block.\n   - Do NOT include explanatory text outside the required output format.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## PubMed Query Blocks\n\n### Block A Query\n(query text)\n\n### Block B Query\n(query text)\n\n(Repeat for each block)\n\n## Final Combined PubMed Query\n```text\n(full PubMed query)\n"}
{"ts": "2026-01-03T02:36:02.929546+00:00", "event": "llm.complete_text.response", "model": "gpt-5.2", "api": "chat/completions", "full_prompt": "You are an expert biomedical information retrieval engineer specializing in PubMed search strategies.\n\nBelow is a Conceptual Retrieval Framework, your task is to convert the framework into one or more executable PubMed search queries.\n\n-- Conceptual Retrieval Framework begin --\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: Closed-loop / Real-time Adaptive Control (Neuromodulation Pipeline)\n- Concept Role: Captures the requirement that stimulation is adjusted online based on ongoing measurements (i.e., not open-loop or purely offline analysis).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - closed-loop\n  - closed loop\n  - feedback control\n  - feedback-controlled\n  - adaptive stimulation\n  - real-time\n  - realtime\n  - online\n  - state-dependent stimulation\n  - brain-state–dependent\n  - brain state dependent\n  - responsive stimulation\n  - closed-loop neuromodulation\n  - closed-loop stimulation\n  - control system\n  - controller\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Many relevant papers use “state-dependent,” “responsive,” or “feedback-controlled” without explicitly saying “closed-loop.”\n  - Include both “online” and “real-time,” as authors vary in phrasing.\n\n### Block B: EEG Sensing / Continuous EEG-based State Estimation\n- Concept Role: Ensures the loop is driven by EEG acquisition and EEG-derived brain-state decoding/estimation (not other sensing modalities).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - electroencephalography\n  - EEG\n  - scalp EEG\n  - continuous EEG\n  - ongoing EEG\n  - EEG monitoring\n  - EEG decoding\n  - EEG-based decoding\n  - brain-state decoding\n  - brain state estimation\n  - state estimation\n  - feature extraction (EEG)\n  - EEG biomarkers\n  - EEG phase\n  - oscillatory phase\n  - phase estimation\n  - spectral power\n  - band power\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - “Decoding” may appear as “state estimation,” “classification,” or “biomarker-driven,” but the common denominator is EEG-derived state used for control.\n  - Include “phase”/“oscillatory phase” because EEG-to-stimulation timing is often framed as phase-locked or phase-triggered control.\n\n### Block C: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as the Intervention (TMS Delivery)\n- Concept Role: Restricts the intervention to TMS (including parameter/timing adaptation), excluding other stimulation modalities.\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - transcranial magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS\n  - single-pulse TMS\n  - paired-pulse TMS\n  - repetitive TMS\n  - rTMS\n  - theta burst stimulation\n  - TBS\n  - magnetic stimulation\n  - TMS pulse timing\n  - stimulation timing\n  - stimulation parameter(s)\n  - stimulation intensity\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Some papers emphasize specific TMS paradigms (e.g., rTMS, TBS) rather than the generic term; include both.\n  - Timing/parameter language helps capture “adaptive TMS” papers that may not foreground “closed-loop” in the title/abstract.\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nDocuments must simultaneously involve (A) closed-loop/real-time adaptive control, (B) EEG-based continuous sensing and brain-state estimation/decoding, and (C) TMS as the stimulation intervention being adapted.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n  - EEG-driven closed-loop (feedback/online/state-dependent/responsive) systems that adapt TMS timing and/or stimulation parameters in real time based on decoded/estimated brain state from EEG.\n  - Methodological development and evaluation of EEG-to-TMS online control pipelines (including decoding + controller + stimulation adaptation), independent of any specific clinical application.\n- Out-of-scope:\n  - Open-loop TMS studies (fixed timing/parameters) even if EEG is recorded only for analysis or outcome measurement.\n  - Closed-loop neuromodulation using non-EEG sensing (e.g., MEG, fMRI, ECoG, EMG) as the primary feedback signal.\n  - Closed-loop stimulation modalities other than TMS (e.g., tDCS/tACS/tES, DBS, VNS) even if EEG-driven.\n  - Pure EEG decoding/BCI papers with no TMS intervention, and TMS-EEG artifact/measurement papers that do not implement adaptive/closed-loop control.\n-- Conceptual Retrieval Framework end --\n\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Do NOT reinterpret, merge, or split any concept blocks.\n   - Treat each concept block as an independent retrieval dimension.\n   - Preserve the block structure exactly as given.\n\n2. For each concept block:\n   - Combine all normalized search terms within that block using OR.\n   - Apply PubMed field tags consistently, using Title/Abstract fields\n     unless a term is a standard abbreviation or acronym.\n\n3. Across concept blocks:\n   - Combine blocks using AND.\n   - The final query must require that all blocks are satisfied simultaneously.\n\n4. Do NOT introduce new search terms, synonyms, or expansions.\n   - Use ONLY the terms explicitly listed in the framework.\n\n5. Phrase handling:\n   - Multi-word terms must be enclosed in double quotation marks.\n   - Singular/plural variations should be preserved as given; do not infer new ones.\n\n6. PubMed field usage:\n   - Use [Title/Abstract] for most terms.\n   - Acronyms (e.g., BCI, ECoG, iEEG) may be used without field tags\n     only if they are standard and unambiguous.\n   - Do NOT use MeSH terms in this step.\n\n7. If a block contains usage constraints (e.g., “only when paired with X”),\n   enforce this by block-level AND logic, not by modifying individual terms.\n\n8. Output formatting:\n   - Clearly label each block’s query segment.\n   - Provide the final combined PubMed query in a single code block.\n   - Do NOT include explanatory text outside the required output format.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## PubMed Query Blocks\n\n### Block A Query\n(query text)\n\n### Block B Query\n(query text)\n\n(Repeat for each block)\n\n## Final Combined PubMed Query\n```text\n(full PubMed query)\n", "raw_response": "## PubMed Query Blocks\n\n### Block A Query\n(\"closed-loop\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"closed loop\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"feedback \"online\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"state-dependent stimulation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"brain-state–dependent\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"brain state dependent\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"responsive stimulation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"closed-loop neuromodulation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"closed-loop stimulation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"control system\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"controller\"[Title/Abstract])\n\n### Block B Query\n(\"electroencephalography\"[Title/Abstract] OR EEG OR \"scalp EEG\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"continuous EEG\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"ongoing EEG\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"EEG monitoring\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"EEG decoding\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"EEG-based decoding\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"brain-state decoding\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"brain state estimation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"state estimation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"feature extraction (EEG)\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"EEG biomarkers\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"EEG phase\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"oscillatory phase\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"phase estimation\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"spectral power\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"band power\"[Title/Abstract])\n\n### Block C Query\n(\"transcranial magnetic stimulation\"[Title/Abstract] OR TMS OR \"single-pulse TMS\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"paired-pulse TMS\"[Title/Abstract] OR \"repetitive TMS\"[Title/Abstract] OR rTMS OR \"theta burst There is no restriction on the target application, outcome, EEG decoding or the control approach.\"\"\"\n\n请严格按以下schema输出JSON：\n{\n  \"is_research_description\": boolean,\n  \"plausibility_level\": \"A_impossible\" | \"B_plausible\",\n  \"is_clear_for_search\": boolean,\n  \"is_helpful\": boolean,\n  \"normalized_understanding\": string,\n  \"structured_summary\": {\n    \"domain\": string | null,\n    \"task\": string | null,\n    \"subject_system\": string | null,\n    \"methods\": string | null,\n    \"scope\": string | null,\n    \"intent\": string | null,\n    \"exclusions\": string | null\n  },\n  \"uncertainties\": [string],\n  \"missing_fields\": [\"domain\",\"task\",\"subject_system\",\"methods\",\"scope\",\"intent\",\"exclusions\"],\n  \"suggested_questions\": [\n    {\"field\":\"domain|task|subject_system|methods|scope|intent|exclusions\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string},\n    {\"field\":\"...\", \"question\": string}\n  ]\n  }\n\n约束：\n- 用英文回答。\n- 如果is_research_description = false，则\n  - uncertainties 给出判断不是research statement的原因。\n  - 其他所有字段都为空。\n- normalized_understanding：300-600英文字符，必须是你融合两段文本后的“当前理解”，术语一致、范围聚焦。\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=true：\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties 允许为空或最多1条轻微风险\n- 如果 plausibility_level=B_plausible且is_clear_for_search=false：\n  - uncertainties 至少2条\n  - suggested_questions 为1-3条，必须与uncertainties/missing_fields一致\n\n- 如果 plausibility_level=A_impossible：\n  - is_clear_for_search 必须为 false\n  - suggested_questions 必须为空数组\n  - uncertainties <=200英文字符：提示用户impossible的原因。\n"}

{"ts": "2026-01-03T02:48:52.582181+00:00", "event": "phase1.parse.prompt", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "3af75f817df8", "model": "gpt-5.2", "reasoning_effort": "high", "prompt": "You are an expert academic search strategist specializing in exhaustive literature retrieval. \n\nBelow is a short research summary, your task is to take above research summary and directly produce a conceptual retrieval framework that can be used to systematically search for all relevant literature in that research field.\n\n-- research summary begin --\nThe research focuses on EEG-driven closed-loop neuromodulation where real-time EEG features are decoded to adaptively control transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) parameters. The goal is to design and evaluate feedback control algorithms that adjust stimulation timing and/or intensity based on ongoing brain state, without committing to a specific clinical target, outcome metric, decoding pipeline, or control strategy.\n-- research summary end --\n\nThis is NOT a query-generation task.\nThis is a concept-framework construction task.\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Base the framework ONLY on the content explicitly stated or clearly implied in the research summary.\n   - Do NOT introduce new research goals, populations, or application domains.\n   - Do NOT speculate beyond the summary.\n\n2. The output must define a SMALL NUMBER of concept blocks (typically 2–4).\n   - Each block represents a distinct and independently searchable conceptual dimension\nthat should not be merged with other dimensions if doing so would reduce recall.\n   - Examples include: research task, technical field/framing, data modality.\n   - All blocks together must uniquely define ONE narrow research field.\n\nIMPORTANT — Concept Block Separation Rule:\n\nWhen constructing concept blocks, prioritize retrieval independence over semantic compactness.\n\nIf two concepts frequently appear separately in relevant literature\n(e.g., one may be mentioned without the other in titles/abstracts),\nthey MUST be placed in separate concept blocks,\neven if they form a well-known combined phrase or subfield name.\n\nExample:\n- “speech” and “brain-computer interface” must be separate blocks,\n  because many relevant papers mention speech decoding without explicitly using “BCI”,\n  and others mention BCI without explicitly using “speech”.\n\n\n3. Each concept block must:\n   - Contain only terms that are conceptually equivalent within that block.\n   - Be expressed using terminology commonly found in academic databases.\n   - Include common synonyms, abbreviations, and canonical terms used in the literature.\n\n4. When the summary uses abstract or high-level language, normalize it into concrete, database-searchable concepts\n   ONLY when such normalization is standard practice in the field.\n   - Example: “invasive recordings” → ECoG, sEEG, intracortical recordings, MEA\n   - Do NOT introduce loosely related or adjacent techniques.\n\n5. All concept blocks must be REQUIRED.\n   - The framework should be designed for exhaustive retrieval within a specific field,\n     not for exploratory or cross-domain search.\n\n6. Do NOT generate executable Boolean queries.\n   - You MAY describe the logical relationship between blocks conceptually\n     (e.g., “documents must address all blocks simultaneously”),\n     but do not use database syntax.\n\n7. Explicitly prevent topic drift.\n   - The framework should clearly exclude adjacent but distinct research areas.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n### Block B: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n(Repeat blocks as needed)\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nA single sentence explaining how all blocks jointly define the target literature set.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n- Out-of-scope:\n"}
{"ts": "2026-01-03T02:49:14.693971+00:00", "event": "llm.complete_text.response", "model": "gpt-5.2", "api": "chat/completions", "full_prompt": "You are an expert academic search strategist specializing in exhaustive literature retrieval. \n\nBelow is a short research summary, your task is to take above research summary and directly produce a conceptual retrieval framework that can be used to systematically search for all relevant literature in that research field.\n\n-- research summary begin --\nThe research focuses on EEG-driven closed-loop neuromodulation where real-time EEG features are decoded to adaptively control transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) parameters. The goal is to design and evaluate feedback control algorithms that adjust stimulation timing and/or intensity based on ongoing brain state, without committing to a specific clinical target, outcome metric, decoding pipeline, or control strategy.\n-- research summary end --\n\nThis is NOT a query-generation task.\nThis is a concept-framework construction task.\n\nYou must follow these rules strictly:\n\n1. Base the framework ONLY on the content explicitly stated or clearly implied in the research summary.\n   - Do NOT introduce new research goals, populations, or application domains.\n   - Do NOT speculate beyond the summary.\n\n2. The output must define a SMALL NUMBER of concept blocks (typically 2–4).\n   - Each block represents a distinct and independently searchable conceptual dimension\nthat should not be merged with other dimensions if doing so would reduce recall.\n   - Examples include: research task, technical field/framing, data modality.\n   - All blocks together must uniquely define ONE narrow research field.\n\nIMPORTANT — Concept Block Separation Rule:\n\nWhen constructing concept blocks, prioritize retrieval independence over semantic compactness.\n\nIf two concepts frequently appear separately in relevant literature\n(e.g., one may be mentioned without the other in titles/abstracts),\nthey MUST be placed in separate concept blocks,\neven if they form a well-known combined phrase or subfield name.\n\nExample:\n- “speech” and “brain-computer interface” must be separate blocks,\n  because many relevant papers mention speech decoding without explicitly using “BCI”,\n  and others mention BCI without explicitly using “speech”.\n\n\n3. Each concept block must:\n   - Contain only terms that are conceptually equivalent within that block.\n   - Be expressed using terminology commonly found in academic databases.\n   - Include common synonyms, abbreviations, and canonical terms used in the literature.\n\n4. When the summary uses abstract or high-level language, normalize it into concrete, database-searchable concepts\n   ONLY when such normalization is standard practice in the field.\n   - Example: “invasive recordings” → ECoG, sEEG, intracortical recordings, MEA\n   - Do NOT introduce loosely related or adjacent techniques.\n\n5. All concept blocks must be REQUIRED.\n   - The framework should be designed for exhaustive retrieval within a specific field,\n     not for exploratory or cross-domain search.\n\n6. Do NOT generate executable Boolean queries.\n   - You MAY describe the logical relationship between blocks conceptually\n     (e.g., “documents must address all blocks simultaneously”),\n     but do not use database syntax.\n\n7. Explicitly prevent topic drift.\n   - The framework should clearly exclude adjacent but distinct research areas.\n\n### Output Format (must follow exactly):\n\n## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n### Block B: [Concept Block Name]\n- Concept Role:\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n\n(Repeat blocks as needed)\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nA single sentence explaining how all blocks jointly define the target literature set.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n- Out-of-scope:\n", "raw_response": "## Conceptual Retrieval Framework\n\n### Block A: EEG-based Real-time Brain-State Decoding (Input Signal)\n- Concept Role: Captures literature where ongoing EEG is measured and features/brain state are extracted for online use (the sensing/decoding side of the loop).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - electroencephalography; EEG\n  - real-time EEG; online EEG; continuous EEG; streaming EEG\n  - EEG feature extraction; EEG features; EEG biomarkers\n  - EEG decoding; brain-state decoding; state estimation (EEG); brain state classification (EEG)\n  - EEG phase; phase estimation; phase tracking; phase-locked (EEG)\n  - EEG oscillations; neural oscillations (EEG); rhythmic activity (EEG)\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Include both “decoding” and “feature extraction/biomarker” language because relevant papers may avoid the term “decode.”\n  - “Phase/oscillation” terms are included because timing control of stimulation is commonly described via phase/oscillatory state rather than generic “brain state.”\n\n### Block B: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as the Controlled Intervention (Output Actuator)\n- Concept Role: Restricts retrieval to studies where the intervention being adaptively controlled is TMS (not other stimulation modalities).\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - transcranial magnetic stimulation; TMS\n  - magnetic stimulation; transcranial magnetic pulse(s)\n  - single-pulse TMS; paired-pulse TMS; repetitive TMS; rTMS\n  - TMS intensity; stimulation intensity (TMS); stimulator output\n  - stimulation timing (TMS); pulse timing; trigger timing; inter-pulse interval (when explicitly tied to TMS)\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Keep TMS-specific parameter language (timing/intensity) because some papers emphasize “triggering” or “dose” without repeating “closed-loop” terminology.\n\n### Block C: Closed-loop / Feedback / Adaptive Control Linking EEG to TMS (Control Architecture)\n- Concept Role: Ensures the work is genuinely closed-loop: EEG-derived information is used to adapt TMS parameters in real time via feedback/adaptive control.\n- Normalized Search Terms:\n  - closed-loop; closed loop; closed-loop stimulation\n  - feedback control; feedback; control algorithm; controller\n  - adaptive stimulation; adaptive control; real-time adaptation\n  - state-dependent stimulation; brain-state–dependent stimulation; state-locked stimulation\n  - EEG-triggered TMS; EEG-guided TMS; EEG-informed TMS\n  - responsive stimulation; contingent stimulation; event-triggered stimulation (when tied to EEG/TMS)\n- Notes on Term Usage:\n  - Include both “closed-loop” and “state-dependent/EEG-triggered” phrasing because many relevant papers describe the mechanism without using “closed-loop.”\n  - “Control algorithm/controller” terms capture engineering/control-focused papers that may not foreground “neuromodulation” keywords.\n\n## Conceptual Combination Rule\nDocuments must simultaneously involve (A) real-time EEG-derived features/brain-state decoding, (B) TMS as the stimulation modality, and (C) a closed-loop/feedback/adaptive control scheme where EEG information adjusts TMS timing and/or intensity.\n\n## Scope Control\n- In-scope:\n  - EEG-driven closed-loop neuromodulation where EEG features are decoded online to adaptively control TMS parameters (especially timing and/or intensity), including design/evaluation of feedback control algorithms.\n- Out-of-scope:\n  - Open-loop TMS studies (no EEG-based adaptation).\n  - EEG studies without TMS (e.g., EEG-only decoding/BCI without stimulation).\n  - Closed-loop stimulation using non-TMS modalities (e.g., tACS/tDCS, DBS, VNS, ultrasound) even if EEG-driven.\n  - Offline EEG analyses used only to plan TMS protocols without real-time/online adaptation.\n  - Studies where adaptation is driven by non-EEG signals (e.g., EMG, behavior, fMRI) unless EEG is the controlling input.", "project_id": "6af7ac1b6254", "run_id": "3af75f817df8", "step": "parse"}
